baby_step_column_fields.text: Find an issue to work on.

receive_feedback.metric: Received critical feedback on a PR/issue which was then followed up with a resubmission that was eventually accepted.

baby_step_column_fields.text: Write out your plan as a comment on the issue thread asap. Ask for feedback.

proof_of_completion.text: Did you receive (and act on) one point of critical feedback on this issue?
Write a 1 sentence summary of the feedback you received and the action you took to address it.

baby_step_column_fields.text: Find out what resources are available to you within the project's ecosystem (join their Discord, find the project's wiki page, etc.). Be prepared to ask a high-quality question on the Github thread within 1-2 weeks to confirm whether you are on the right track.

proof_of_completion.text: Did you solve the issue within 3 months?

blog_post.quality: Understanding the impact of the work

baby_step_column_fields.text: Draft a short outline of the main points you want to cover in your blog post.

proof_of_completion.text: Link to the blog post:

edge_cases.metric: 1 PR with a detailed breakdown of edge cases considered.

baby_step_column_fields.text: List the critical edge cases you plan to test and why each one matters.

proof_of_completion.text: Did you write a detailed breakdown of edges cases in the pull request description?

high_quality_question.metric: 1 example of a high-quality question asked on the Github thread

baby_step_column_fields.text: Write a draft of the high-quality question you want to ask on the issue or PR.

proof_of_completion.text: Link to the github comment where you asked a high-quality question:

propose_implementation_plan.metric: 1 example of a proposal where you seek feedback on how you plan to solve the issue

baby_step_column_fields.text: Write a brief implementation plan (steps, tradeoffs) you can share with the maintainer for feedback.

proof_of_completion.text: Link to the github comment where you proposed your implementation plan:

above_and_beyond.metric: Solution goes beyond the acceptance criteria for the issue.

baby_step_column_fields.text: Brainstorm at least one concrete way you could go beyond the stated acceptance criteria.

proof_of_completion.text: Write a 1 sentence explanation of how your solution went beyond the acceptance criteria for the issue.

give_feedback.metric: Leave a comment on a PR/issue that is not your own.

baby_step_column_fields.text: Identify a PR or issue from someone else and note one specific thing you could give feedback on.

proof_of_completion.text: Link to the github issue or PR where you left a comment:

find_bug.metric: Find and file a new bug.

baby_step_column_fields.text: Describe where in the product you will explore to try to find a new bug.

proof_of_completion.text: Link to the new issue you created:

complex_bug.metric: Solve a complex bug, explore multiple branches, get to the root cause.

baby_step_column_fields.text: Outline your initial hypothesis for the root cause and how you plan to investigate it.

proof_of_completion.text: Link to a blog post, video, or detailed pull request description where you explain the solution:

initiative.metric: Submit a proposal for solving a problem for the project that wasn't directly asked for.

baby_step_column_fields.text: Use the product to do something useful for yourself or for a hypothetical user
Solve at least 2 issues first and pay attention to the maintainers' comments
Reach out to a user to understand their needs
Set up a coffee chat with the maintainer

proof_of_completion.text: Link to the new issue you created where you described your proposal:

use_product.metric: Self-host the product and use it in a meaningful way or use the product/library in a personal project.

baby_step_column_fields.text: Write a short description of the scenario or workflow where you plan to use the product.

proof_of_completion.text: Link to a video walkthrough demonstrating how you used the product:

advocate.metric: 1 example of back-and-forth conversation where you advocate for your perspective while also demonstrating flexibility.

baby_step_column_fields.text: Write a short script of how you would advocate for your perspective while staying open to feedback.

proof_of_completion.text: Write a 1 sentence summary of the conversation you had and the outcome.

seek_feedback.metric: Feedback was proactively sought either from maintainers or users

proof_of_completion.text: Link to the github comment where you sought feedback:
Write a 1 sentence summary of the feedback you received and how you incorporated it into your work.

thorough_documentation.metric: 1 example of a PR with thorough documentation explaining the contribution.

baby_step_column_fields.text: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua.

proof_of_completion.text: Did you include a thorough explanation of the contribution in the pull request description?

AI_usage.quality: Apply AI to solve every day problems
AI_usage.metric: 1 example of using AI APIs to simplify or automate personal or business workflows
